DOC.brief_summary: The aim study determine surgical site infection rate patient satisfaction subcuticular versus interrupt mattress suture closure skin Cesarean delivery obese patient .
DOC.brief_title: Surgical Site Infection Rates Obese Patients After Cesarean Delivery
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize controlled trial conduct Ain-Shams University Maternity Hospital period March 2012 till August 2012 . It include 130 pregnant woman underwent elective Cesarean section . The aim study determine surgical site infection rate patient satisfaction subcuticular versus interrupt mattress suture closure skin Cesarean delivery obese patient .
DOC.criteria: Age : female childbearing period . Women plan elective Cesarean section . Obese woman ( BMI â‰¥ 30 Kg/m2 ) . Our study calculate BMI patient weight height admission , prepregnancy BMI available patient , hypothesize BMI admission well indicator body mass atrisk time development SSI prepregnancy BMI . Women concurrent overt infection ( e.g.chorioamnionitis , pyelonephritis chest infection ) . Women intraoperative event may predispose perioperative infection ( e.g . bowel injury , operative time 90 minute , major blood loss ) . Women hemoglobin less 10g/dl , preeclampsia , diabetes , rupture membrane 12 hour , corticosteroid therapy . Patients non Pfannenstiel incision .
